base_note.note_text:
THORACOSCOPY PROCEDURE NOTE
Date: 2025-03-08
Patient: George Martinez | MRN: 7601167 | Age: 72M
Attending: Dr. Lisa Chang, MD
Location: Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, Los Angeles, CA

INDICATION: Recurrent right malignant pleural effusion (lung adenocarcinoma, EGFR+). Prior thoracenteses x 4. Patient prefers pleurodesis over IPC.

PROCEDURE: 
1. Medical thoracoscopy (pleuroscopy)
2. Pleural biopsy
3. Talc poudrage pleurodesis
4. Chest tube placement

ANESTHESIA: Moderate sedation with local anesthesia

PROCEDURE: Patient in left lateral decubitus. Entry via 7th ICS mid-axillary line. 1000mL serous fluid drained. Thoracoscope (LTF-160) introduced. Findings:
- Parietal pleura: Diffuse nodular studding, largest 5mm
- Visceral pleura: Scattered nodules
- Diaphragm: Nodular implants
- Lung: Partially trapped, ~70% expansion achievable

Multiple biopsies taken from parietal and diaphragmatic pleura using flexible forceps (8 specimens total).

After fluid evacuation and lung re-expansion to ~80%, talc poudrage performed (4g sterile talc via atomizer, even distribution). 24Fr chest tube placed, connected to suction (-20cmH2O).

SPECIMENS: Pleural biopsies x 8, pleural fluid (cytology, cell block)
COMPLICATIONS: None
EBL: Minimal
DISPOSITION: Admit for chest tube management. Target removal in 48-72hr if output <150mL/day and lung expanded.

Dr. Lisa Chang, MD

coding_review.overall_assessment: Medical thoracoscopy with both biopsy and pleurodesis - both codes reportable.

cpt_codes.description: Thoracoscopy; with biopsy of a single segment, ipsilateral
Thoracoscopy, surgical; with pleurodesis (includes preparation)

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 32609, 32650; total_work_rvu=21.25, total_rvu=31.88 (facility).

variations.note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Raymond Anderson
Medical Record Number: 3193781
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2025-11-07

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with recurrent malignant pleural effusion. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Thoracoscopy:

Pleurodesis:


INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
- Parietal pleura: Diffuse nodular studding, largest 5mm
- Visceral pleura: Scattered nodules
- Diaphragm: Nodular implants
- Lung: Partially trapped, ~70% expansion achievable


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 32609, 32650

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

variations.note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE - CODING DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

Patient: Janice Gonzales | MRN: 6446602 | DOS: 2025-03-31

CPT CODE JUSTIFICATION
----------------------------------------

CPT 32609:
  Rationale: Thoracoscopy with pleural biopsy
  Facility RVU: 10.12
  Facility Payment: $327

CPT 32650:
  Rationale: Thoracoscopy with pleurodesis (talc)
  Facility RVU: 10.53
  Facility Payment: $341

DOCUMENTED TECHNIQUES AND EQUIPMENT
----------------------------------------


PROCEDURE-SPECIFIC DOCUMENTATION:

THORACOSCOPY:
  - Type: Medical/Pleuroscopy
  - Biopsy Taken: True
  - Number Of Biopsies: 8

PLEURODESIS:
  - Agent: Talc poudrage
  - Dose Grams: 4

TOTAL RVU SUMMARY:
----------------------------------------
  Total Facility RVU: 20.65
  Total Facility Payment: $668.0

Documentation supports medical necessity and procedure complexity as coded.

PROCEDURE NOTE

Date: 2024-03-30
Patient: Shirley Liu
MRN: 9100109
Age/Sex: Noneyo patient

Attending Physician: [Attending]
Resident/Fellow: [Trainee, PGY-X]

INDICATION:
Recurrent malignant pleural effusion

CONSENT:
Informed consent obtained. Risks, benefits, and alternatives discussed.
Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to proceed.

TIMEOUT:
Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

SEDATION:
Moderate

PROCEDURE STEPS:
1. Patient positioned and monitored
2. Sedation administered per protocol
3. Topical anesthesia applied to airway
4. Thoracoscopy performed
5. Pleurodesis performed
6. Scope withdrawn
7. Patient recovered without complication

SPECIMENS:
total).

COMPLICATIONS:
None

EBL:
Minimal

DISPOSITION:
To recovery, stable condition

CPT CODES: 32609, 32650

ATTESTATION:
I was present for the entire procedure and agree with the above documentation.
[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2024-05-25, Jacob Hall, a None-year-old patient (MRN 7853298), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for Recurrent malignant pleural effusion. The patient received Moderate and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included thoracoscopy, and pleurodesis. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is malignancy. 

Procedural coding: 32609, 32650.
